title: Constructing a Histogram
question_text: When constructing a histogram, it is important to

choices.text: Construct the histogram only if the data appears approximately normal.
Keep the bars on the $x$-axis of equal width.

solution:
The bars of a histogram should be of equal width to most fairly and accurately display the data.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; histograms deal only with quantitative data, while bar graphs look similar to histograms but deal only with categorical data.

Choice 'B' is incorrect; histograms need a minimum of 5
bars.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; a histogram can be constructed for any shape of data.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; outliers will not be plotted separately on a histogram; only a modified boxplot will plot outliers separately.
